nodes.text: Star Wars Insider 58
Star Wars Insider 58 is the fifty-eighth issue of Star Wars Insider magazine. It was released to newsstands on February 5, 2002.
Contents
Features
Joel Edgerton shows us what Uncle Owen was like before he became a grumpy old man.
Bonnie Piesse talks about inhabiting the role of Luke Skywalker's Aunt Beru and how visiting Tatooine is far more daunting than working at the circus.
Most fans know Billy Dee Williams as the smooth Lando Calrissian, but there's far more to the creative talents of this veteran actor.
The new Star Wars trading card game includes an early look at images from Attack of the Clones.
A legion of fans prefer the glorious Empire to the scrappy Rebellion, at least when it comes to making a fashion statement.
Departments
Counting blue ghosts, defending sneaky Jedi, and championing heroic handmaidens. Don't you people have jobs?
From the trailers to pick-up shots, Producer Rick McCallum reports on the final phases of Attack of the Clones.
Jedi as a religion, trailer mania, star sightings, and more.
How a Toydarian junk dealer came to life in The Phantom Menace.
The Star Wars Roleplaying Game gets more than a facelift in a revised and expanded edition.
After the tragic events of Star By Star, Elaine Cunningham takes Jaina Solo on a The New Jedi Order: Dark Journey.
Jango Fett and Zam Wessell, together again for the first time.
The dirtiest jobs the Rebellion ever faced.
How much is George's autograph really worth?
Test your knowledge of the Mos Eisley cantina.
New innovations in magazine technology provide actual answers to your Star Wars questions.
Notes and references
